author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: A look at some famous faces who have worked as teachers
text:
Theo Wargo/NBC/Getty Images for "The Tonight Sh Actor Hugh Jackman used to be a physical education teacher in England. On World Teachers Day , we celebrate the hard work of our educators and all they do in the classroom.
But few know that Hollywood is filled with many stars who started off as teachers before they rose to fame.
Here is a look at some famous faces who worked as teachers prior to having a career in the spotlight:
1. J.K. Rowling
The British novelist taught English at a school in Portugal prior to finding success with the “Harry Potter” book series.
Dave M. Benett/Getty Images J.K. Rowling, novelist of the ‘Harry Potter’ book series taught English classes before finding success as an author. Singer Sheryl Crow taught music classes in a Missouri elementary school right out of college. Singer Art Garfunkel taught mathematics at a private school in Connecticut at the peak of his musical career as one half of folk duo, ‘Simon and Garfunkel.’ Previous Next Enlarge 2. Hugh Jackman
Yes, Wolverine made sure kids’ physical fitness was up to par back in the day.
The actor taught physical education at the Uppingham School in England.
The actor actually ran into one of his former pupils, Rollo Ross , now an entertainment reporter, during an interview in 2013.
3. Sheryl Crow
In the 1980s, the “Soak up the Sun” singer taught music at an elementary school in Missouri after graduating from college.
4. Art Garfunkel
Art Garfunkel of “Simon and Garfunkel” also worked as a mathmatics teacher at a private school in Connecticut during the peak of the famed folk duo’s success.
The singer also has his Master of Arts in mathematics from Columbia University.
CHRIS PIZZELLO/AP Gene Simmons of the rock group ‘Kiss,’ now known for his wild on-stage persona, used to teach middle school students in Harlem. CHUCK BURTON/AP Maya Angelou, the widely esteemed poet and author taught classes in various subjects throughout her career. JIMMY MALECKI/© 2000 ABC, INC. Author Stephen King pursued a writing career while teaching English courses in the 1970s. Previous Next Enlarge 5. Gene Simmons
The “Kiss” frontman is known for his wild antics on stage, but Simmons used to teach middle school at a public school in Harlem.
Simmons was allegedly fired from the gig after having his students read “Spiderman” comics instead of Shakespeare plays.
Anonymous/AP Author of the coming-of-age novel, ‘Lord of the Flies,’ Sir William Golding taught English and philosophy in England. 6. Maya Angelou
The poet and author taught classes at several universities including Wake Forest University in North Carolina throughout her career.
In 2008, she said in an interview with USA Today, “I’m not a writer who teaches. I’m a teacher who writes. But I had to work at Wake Forest to know that.”
7. Stephen King
Science fiction and horror book author Stephen King taught English to high school students in the 1970s while pursuing his writing career.
After his novel, “Carrie,” was picked up for publishing, King decided to write full-time and leave his teaching career behind.
8. Sir William Golding
Author of the popular coming-of-age novel, “Lord of the Flies,” Sir William Golding taught philosophy and English at the Bishop Wordsworth’s School in England.
Golding won the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1983.
9. Mr. T.
In the 1970s, the actor taught physical education classes at a public school in Chicago.
We pity the fool who acted out in his gym class.
©Universal/courtesy Everett / Ev In the 1970s, actor Mr. T. taught gym classes at a public school in Chicago. Slaven Vlasic/Getty Images Broadcast journalist Bill O’Reilly taught English and history courses in Florida during the 1970s. Previous Next Enlarge 10. Bill O’Reilly
Long before he became the stern broadcast journalist we know today, O’Reilly taught Florida high school classes English and history in the 1970s.
O’Reilly earned his Master of Arts degree in broadcast journalism at Boston University.
